newsitem.title: USA: Schick Technologies says plans to go public.
newsitem.headline: Schick Technologies says plans to go public.

text.p: Schick Technologies Inc, a maker of digital radiography devices used in dental X-ray computer imaging systems, said it plans to go public.
The Long Island, N.Y.,-based company said it expects to file a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission in the second quarter of 1997.
The company said it expects to make the public offering in the third quarter. A spokesman said the number of shares to be sold has not yet been determined.

Schick said the net proceeds from the offering are expected to be used for working capital and other general corporate purposes, including expansion of its research and development and marketing operations.
